name: identifiably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that can be recognized: The piece shouldn't be too long, and must be identifiably Scottish. Some groups are at an identifiably increased risk of contracting the disease due partly to genetics.
More examplesFewer examplesThe report notes that a majority of the party's supporters hold identifiably "right-wing" views.The popular streaming service is clear in its intention to develop more shows that are identifiably British Asian.The study was designed to determine whether mothers display identifiably different communication styles in their interactions with their children.
